data.title: CHEVY DEMO DAY AT HURLEY
data.description: We're fans of new technology around here (and no, it doesn't just have to do with boardshorts). That's why when Chevy approached us about coming to campus to showcase their new line of hybrids and electric cars, we jumped on board. Innovative clean technology? You had us at innovative. Check out the highlights from our day (or lunch hour) with Chevy.

data.title: WAVE OF THE WEEK: BRETT SIMPSON
data.description: Brett liens into one. Did you know: The lien air gets its name from the man who invented the maneuver -- Neil Blender? Lien, not coincidentally, is Neil spelled backwards (how's that for a killer -- or moderately cool -- conversation piece?).

data.title: MURAL, MURAL ON THE WALL
data.description: Jason Maloney knows how to paint a mural. The guy was beautifying structures back when spray paint was still legal. So what better candidate to team up with Laguna Beach High School art teacher Kerry Pellow and 30 of her students for a 60-foot, hand-painted mural at the school. No Tipsy elephants in this one, but it certainly has the Maloney thumbprint along with the thumbprints of 30 other gifted future artists.
